task-wr.title: Suppressing and Unsuppressing Events
task-wr.shortdesc: You can set events to a suppressed state and toggle them back to unsuppressed.

step.cmd: Open the Events Suppression tab on the Fault Managementpage, available from menucascade; CGTS-4521 change names Admin Platform Fault Management in the left-hand pane.

stepresult.p: The Events Suppression tab appears. It provides the status of each event and functionality for suppressing or unsuppressing each event, depending on the current status of the event.

step.cmd: Locate the event ID that you want to suppress.
Click the Suppress Event button for that event.

stepresult.p: You are prompted to confirm that you want to suppress the event.

note.p: Suppressing an Alarm will result in the system not notifying the operator of this particular fault.

step.cmd: Click Suppress Event in the Confirm Suppress Event dialog box.

stepresult.p: The Events Suppression tab is refreshed to show the selected event ID with a status of Suppressed, as shown below. The Suppress Event Suppress button is replaced by Unsuppress Event, providing a way to toggle the event back to unsuppressed. I think the color of the button should change as well as the text. It would make it jump out more. Iexpected it to change color. One button should be green, the other red, I would suggest.
